lineage.Process:

ewshl.shp,LENGTH,-1,-1;YORKCO_LUB 'YORKCO_LUB' true true false 11 Double 0 11 ,First,#,N:\cci\portfolios\york_co_inv\shapefiles\yorkco_lubc_c.shp,YORKCO_LUB,-1,-1;YORKCO_L_1 'YORKCO_L_1' true true false 11 Double 0 11 ,First,#,N:\cci\portfolios\york_co_inv\shapefiles\yorkco_lubc_c.shp,YORKCO_L_1,-1,-1;YORKSHL_07 'YORKSHL_07' true true false 11 Double 0 11 ,First,#,N:\cci\portfolios\york_co_inv\shapefiles\yorkco_lubc_c.shp,YORKSHL_07,-1,-1,N:\cci\portfolios\york_co_inv\shapefiles

ewshl.shp,FEATURE,-1,-1;HEIGHT 'HEIGHT' true true false 25 Text 0 0 ,First,#,N:\cci\portfolios\york_co_inv\shapefiles\yorkco_lubc_c.shp,HEIGHT,-1,-1,N:\cci\portfolios\york_co_inv\shapefiles

ewshl.shp,BEACH,-1,-1;GPS_DATE 'GPS_DATE' true true false 8 Date 0 0 ,First,#,N:\cci\portfolios\york_co_inv\shapefiles\yorkco_lubc_c.shp,GPS_DATE,-1,-1,N:\cci\portfolios\york_co_inv\shapefiles
ewshl.shp,GPS_DATE,-1,-1;REMOTE 'REMOTE' true true false 5 Text 0 0 ,First,#,N:\cci\portfolios\york_co_inv\shapefiles\yorkco_lubc_c.shp,REMOTE,-1,-1,N:\cci\portfolios\york_co_inv\shapefiles
ewshl.shp,REMOTE,-1,-1;COVER 'COVER' true true false 25 Text 0 0 ,First,#,N:\cci\portfolios\york_co_inv\shapefiles\yorkco_lubc_c.shp,COVER,-1,-1,N:\cci\portfolios\york_co_inv\shapefiles

ewshl.shp,NEWSHL_ID,-1,-1"
CalculateField yorkco_lubc_13 Tree_fring "Yes, with canopy overhang" VB #
CalculateField yorkco_lubc_13 Inv_update "Inventory updated using VBMP 2011 imagery" VB #
CalculateField yorkco_lubc_13 Inv_update "Inventory updated using VBMP 2011 imagery and BING high resolution oblique imagery" VB #
CalculateField yorkco_lubc_13 Inv_update "Inventory updated using VBMP 2011 imagery/Bing high resolution oblique imagery" VB #
CalculateField yorkco_lubc_13 Inv_update "Inventory updated using VBMP 2011 imagery / Bing high resolution oblique imagery" VB #

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

descript.abstract: Shoreline Situation Reports (SSR) were first generated by VIMS in the 1970's to report the condition and status of the shore lands. The SSR series were published in hardcopy on a county by county basis for each Tidewater Virginia localities. The reports were intended to assist planners, managers, and regulators in decisions pertaining to management of coastal areas and natural resources therein. This Shoreline Inventory report continues a process which updates and expands the earlier reports. Data collected reports conditions surveyed in the immediate riparian zone, the bank, and along the shoreline.
descript.purpose: To inventory Virginia's tidal shoreline conditions.
descript.supplinf: There are four shapefiles that are part of the 2013 York County Shoreline Inventory database: yorkco_lubc_13, yorkco_astru_13, yorkco_sstru and yorkco_tm_2013. Yorkco_lubc_13 (land use and bank cover for York County) is a linear shapefile containing data about land use, tree fringe, bank height, bank cover, erosion, and beach status along the shoreline. Yorkco_sstru _13 (York County shoreline structures) is a linear shapefile delineating hard structures in place at the shoreline (bulkhead, breakwater,debris, dilapidated bulkhead, riprap, jetty, marina, marsh toe revetment, wharf, unconventional, groinfields). Yorkco_astru _13 (York County access structures) is a point shapefile with locations of docks, public and private ramps, dilapidated docks, and boathouses.Yorkco_tm_2013 is a polygon shapefile delineating tidal marshes in York County The attributes of these four shapefiles are explained in the Entity and Attribute Information section below.

citeinfo.origin: Comprehensive Coastal Inventory, Virginia Institute of Marine Science
citeinfo.title: York County Land Use and Bank Cover (yorkco_lubc_13)

timeperd.current: ground condition at time of survey

idinfo.useconst: These data should not be used for jurisdictional permit determinations beyond providing general shoreline condition or status information. These data have not been surveyed to property boundaries.

cntinfo.cntpos: Director of Comprehensive Coastal Inventory Program (CCI)

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Comprehensive Coastal Inventory, Virginia Institute of Marine Science

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: currant land use: agriculture, bare, commercial, forest, grass, industrial, marsh island, paved, residential, scrub-shrub
bank height (in feet) from the toe to the edge of the fastland: 0-5, 5-10, 10-30
condition of bank face: erosional, transitional, stable, undercut
coverage of bank: bare <25% vegetative cover, partial 25-75% vegetative cover, total >75% vegetative cover
distribution of trees in the riparian zone

procstep.procdesc: The original 2009 York County Shoreline Inventory was developed using these techniques: data was collected by a two-person field crew (one person collecting land use and bank condition data and one boat operator also collecting shoreline features) using two hand-held Trimble GeoExplorers GPS Units, while navigating along the shoreline. A data dictionary designed for the inventory was installed on each GPS Unit. One data collector records natural features including land use, bank height, presence of marsh or beach, and shoreline stability. A second person collects data on the hardened structures: riprap, bulkheads, docks, boatramps, etc. Point features (docks, boathouses, ramps) were surveyed with a six second observation recorded at 1 reading/second. Linear features were surveyed kinematically at a rate of one observation every 3 seconds.

citeinfo.origin: Commonwealth of Virginia, through Virginia Geographic Network Division of its Department of Technology Planning (VGIN)
citeinfo.title: Virginia Base Mapping Program

srcinfo.srccontr: Used to accurately position land use and land cover data. Provided a new digital shoreline coverage that serves as the base shoreline for shoreline conditions.

procstep.procdesc: Data from the GPS units were postprocessed on a PC with Trimble Pathfinder Office software. Postprocessing includes differential correction using base station data collected at the VIMS laboratory. Corrected data is converted to shapefiles for further processing.

In the ArcMap environment, boat-track arcs were manually shifted to the base shoreline (VBMP). Arcs were split and moved to locations on the shoreline perpendicular to the original locations on the boat-track. Shoreline arc segments were coded, and the shapefiles were visually checked for attribute accuracy between coded shoreline and boat-track data.

In ArcMap, boat-track points were manually shifted to the base shoreline (VBMP). Points were moved to locations on the shoreline perpendicular to the original locations on the boat-track. Points were coded and the access structure (astru) was visually checked for attribute accuracy between coded shoreline and boat-track data.

Land use, dock, and boathouse locations were digitally checked and repositioned if necessary with VBMP imagery displayed as a background coverage. This was done using ArcMap capabilities. Areas inaccessible by boat due to low tide were coded based on features observed on the imagery. The "remote" coded areas were given the item REMOTE = "yes" to distinquish them from GPS collected data.

cntperp.cntorg: Comprehensive Coastal Inventory, Virginia Institute of Marine Science

procstep.procdesc: A portfolio containing seventeen 1:12,000 scale plates was created for York County. Each plate shows four maps: riparian land use, bank conditions, shoreline features, and natural buffers. VBMP (2007) imagery is displayed in the background to provide users with additional information.

cntperp.cntorg: Organization: Comprehensive Coastal Inventory Program, Viginia Institute of Marine Science

procstep.procdesc: To update the York County Inventory, high resolution oblique imagery available through Bing and VBMP 2011 imagery provided the source data that allowed the inventory to be updated without additional field work. Bing imagery provides an excellent platform to assess changes in land use, presence of erosion control structures, and the location of private/public docks, boathouses, marins, and boat ramps. The imagery is less suited to accurately assess changes in bank height or bank condition. By and large, these characteristics are relatively stable over time; the exception being areas with extreme exposure that may have been subject to intense storms since the original survey.

dataqual.logic: Chain-node topology present. Linear coverages were built for lines and point coverages were built for points.
dataqual.complete: All shoreline for York County was coded remotely using high resolution oblique imagery.

horizpa.horizpar: The York County shoreline inventory done in 2009 recorded shoreline attributes with a GPS unit as the boat moved along the shoreline with a horizontal accuracy of +/- 5 meters. Data was transferred from the GPS boat track to an existing digital shoreline coverage by projecting data to the shoreline at a 90 degree angle from the boat track. Rectified imagery were used as a background coverage to aid in data positioning. Land use features were placed along the shore so changes in land use were coincident with changes illustrated in the imagery. Positional accuracy for data that has been corrected with imagery which has a resolution of 2 meters or better. Accuracy limits of the field collected data, however, are set at 5 meters due to the short occupancy of GPS units. In many cases the image correction yields a final positional accuracy much closer to 2 meters or less, depending on image resolution. The 2013 Shoreline Inventory for York County was coded remotely using recent high resolution color infra-red and natural color imagery (2011) with a resolution of 1 meter or better is used along with Bing oblique imagery to identify and code the shoreline for shoreline attributes.
